snippet: Despite big gains, the decades-long fight to control tobacco use is far from won.
abstract: Editorial points out the death toll from tobacco remains stubbornly high despite big gains made in the decades-long fight to control tobacco use; contends percentage of smokers can be driven further down by using a range of new and proven tactics; urges the United States government to help counter the tobacco industry's efforts to spread its noxious products around the world.
lead_paragraph: Despite big gains, the decades-long fight to control tobacco use is far from won.

headline.main: Fitful Progress in the Antismoking Wars
